snippet: Team owners, meeting in Irving, Tex., could vote on changes to the personal conduct policy that may include stiffer penalties for players accused of domestic abuse.
abstract: NFL team owners will meet in Irving, Tex, where they are expected to review and potentially vote on proposed changes to league's personal conduct policy; changes could involve stiffer penalties for players accused of domestic abuse, and are likely to escalate tensions with players union.
lead_paragraph: Team owners, meeting in Irving, Tex., could vote on changes to the personal conduct policy that may include stiffer penalties for players accused of domestic abuse.

headline.main: Union and N.F.L. Are at Odds Over Conduct Policy
headline.print_headline: Proposals on Conduct Create Rift in N.F.L.
